summary: This document appears to be a collection of exhibits filed in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, including phone message slips, financial records, and a flight manifest. The exhibits show communication attempts, financial transactions, and travel details associated with Epstein and his properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the case title and appears as the financially liable party for a phone account and in a flight manifest for his company's jet.

persons.name: Carrie
persons.context: Appears on a phone message slip dated March 30, 2004, with a note about her new phone number.

connections.description: Epstein is likely the employer, as messages are taken for him at his properties, and a note about 'Carrie's' new phone is recorded.

358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: The document is part of the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, filed on June 18, 2019.
It contains numerous 'While You Were Out' phone message slips, indicating frequent communication attempts at Epstein's New York and Palm Beach properties.
A flight manifest for a jet (Registration N90RJE, Type E-727-31) operated by JEGE, INC. is included, dated September 16, 2004.
Financial records show Jeffrey Epstein as the financially liable party for a phone account with an address of 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY, and list his date of birth as May 5, 1950.
Phone call logs from January 2004 and September 2004 show calls between New York and various Florida locations, including West Palm Beach and Boynton Beach.
